text: Calculate molality of 1 litre solution of 93% <math><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>S<math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>4 </mn></msub></math>by volume. The density of solution is 1.84 g ml-1
hint: Given <math><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>S<math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> is 93 % volume  Wt. of <math><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>S<math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> = 93 g Volume of solution = 100 ml Weight of solution = 100 × 1.84 gm = 184 g Wt. of water = 184 – 93 = 91 g Molality = = <math display="block"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow>Moles</mrow> <mrow>wt. of water in kg</mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>
